content.text:
# List of Japanese operations during World War II

This is a list of known Japanese operations planned, executed or aborted during the Second World War.
{| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable"
|+ List of Japanese operations during World War II
|-
! scope="col" data-sort-type=text | Operation
! scope="col" data-sort-type=date | Year
! scope="col" class=unsortable | Description
|-
! scope="row" | Operation FU
| 1940 || invasion of French Indo-China
|-
! scope="row" | Operation AI
| 1941 || attack on Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, United States
|-
! scope="row" | Operation DE
| 1941 || invasion of Dutch East Indies
|-
! scope="row" | Operation T
| 1941 || invasion of Thailand
|-
! scope="row" | Operation E
| 1941 || invasion of China and Northeast British Malaya
|-
! scope="row" | Operation M
| 1941 || invasion of the Philippine Islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation B
| 1941 || invasion of British Borneo and Dutch Borneo
|-
! scope="row" | Operation AL
| 1942 || invasion of the Aleutian Islands, Alaska, United States
|-
! scope="row" | Operation B
| 1942 || invasion of Burma
|-
! scope="row" | Operation C
| 1942 || reconnaissance and raid operations in the Indian Ocean
|-
! scope="row" | Operation D
| 1942 || invasion of the Andaman Islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation H
*Invasion of Celebes (1942)
*Battle of Ambon
*Battle of Timor
| 1942 || invasion of Celebes, Ambon and Timor
|-
! scope="row" | Operation J
| 1942 || invasion of Java, Netherlands East Indies
|-
! scope="row" | Operation K
| 1942 || reconnaissance and air raid on Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, United States
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Ka
| 1942 || plan to destroy the American fleet and recapture Guadalcanal, Solomon Islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation L
| 1942 || landing operation in Palembang, Sumatra
|-
! scope="row" | Operation MI
| 1942 || aborted invasion of Midway Island
|-
! scope="row" | Operation MO
| 1942 || aborted invasion of Port Moresby, New Guinea
|-
! scope="row" | Operation R
| 1942 || invasion of Rabaul, New Britain and Kavieng, New Ireland
|-
! scope="row" | Operation SR
| 1942 || invasion of Lae and Salamaua, New Guinea
|-
! scope="row" | ( Operation ? )
| 1942 || attack along the Kokoda track (New Guinea)
|-
! scope="row" | Operation T
| 1942 || invasion of northern Sumatra
|-
! scope="row" | Operation U
| 1942 || invasion of Burma
|-
! scope="row" | Operation RY
| 1942 || invasion of Nauru and Ocean islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation KE
| 1943 || evacuation of Guadalcanal, Solomon Islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation I
| 1943 || air raid against Allied advances on New Guinea and Guadalcanal, Solomon Islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation SE
| 1943 || air raid against Allied forces staging around Guadalcanal area
|-
! scope="row" | Operation KE (Kiska evacuation)
| 1943 || evacuation of Kiska, Aleutian Islands, Alaska, United States
|-
! scope="row" | Operation RO
| 1943 || defensive plan against Allied attacks on Rabaul, New Britain
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Ta
| 1943 || attack on Bougainville in the Solomon Islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation A-Go
| 1944 || attack of the American fleet off Saipan, Mariana Islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Ban-Go
| 1944 || defensive operation at the Irrawaddy River in Burma
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Dan-Go
| 1944 || operation after the failed operation U-Go offensive in India
|-
! scope="row" | Operation FS
| 1944 || cancelled plan to isolate Australia by capturing New Caledonia, Samoa, and Fiji
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Fu-Go
| 1944 || aerial bombing of the United States via balloons
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Ha-Go
| 1944 || action to isolate and destroy Anglo-Indian forces at Arakan, Burma; precursor to operation U-Go
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Ichi-Go
| 1944 || attack in Eastern China to link up Northern China and Indochina
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Kan-Go
| 1944 || defensive plan in Southern Burma
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Kon
| 1944 || defensive operation on Biak Island, New Guinea
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Sho I
| 1944 || defence plan for the Philippine Islands; part of operation Sho-Go
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Sho II
| 1944 || defence plan for Formosa (Taiwan); part of operation Sho-Go
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Sho III
| 1944 || defence plan for the Ryukyu Islands including Okinawa; part of operation Sho-Go
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Sho IV
| 1944 || defence plan for Hokkaido and the Kuril Islands; part of operation Sho-Go
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Sho-Go
| 1944 || defence plan against American advances toward Japan
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Ta
| 1944 || attack on American forces at Cape Torokina, Bougainville, Solomon Islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation TA
| 1944 || convoys in and out of the Philippines.
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Take-Ichi
| 1944 || convoys to the Doberai Peninsula in Western New Guinea
|-
! scope="row" | Operation To-Go
| 1944 || phase one of Japanese attack in Eastern China; part of operation Ichi-Go
|-
! scope="row" | Operation U-Go
| 1944 || assault on Imphal and Kohima, India
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Yu (also Operation Tatsumaki)
| 1944 || surprise attack raid on American shipping at Majuro atoll
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Tatsumaki
| 1944 || see Operation Yu
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Arashi
| 1945 || air raid on Ulithi Atoll, Caroline Islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Hikari
| 1945 || reconnaissance of Ulithi Atoll, Caroline Islands; part of operation Arashi
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Ketsu-Go
| 1945 || defence plan against potential American invasion of the Japanese home islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Kikusui
| 1945 || special attack against American ships off Okinawa, Japan
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Tan 2
| 1945 || special attack mission against the Allied anchorage at Ulithi, Caroline Islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Ten-Go
| 1945 || defence plan in 1945, consisting of four likely scenarios. Operation Ten'ichi-Go, the first scenario in Ten-Go, is a reaction plan against Allied invasion of Okinawa.
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Ken
| 1945 || cancelled operation to use transports to land suicide troops on American airfields in the Mariana Islands
|-
! scope="row" | Operation Kon-Go
| 1945 || cancelled offensive against American ships using manned torpedoes
|}
See also
